Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) degradation studies are often performed by scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), and X-ray diffraction (XRD).
Titulo: Atomic-resolution analysis of degradation phenomena in SOFCS: A case study of SO2 poisoning in LSM cathodes

Sentencas: However, it is difficult to use these techniques to observe processes occurring at the smallest scales.
Titulo: Atomic-resolution analysis of degradation phenomena in SOFCS: A case study of SO2 poisoning in LSM cathodes

Sentencas: Here, we study sulfur poisoning of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3-delta (LSM) cathodes as a model case for atomic resolution scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) analysis with energy dispersive X-ray diffraction (EDX).
Titulo: Atomic-resolution analysis of degradation phenomena in SOFCS: A case study of SO2 poisoning in LSM cathodes

Sentencas: Significant SrSO4 nano particle formation is observed after SO2 exposure, especially at grain boundaries in the LSM.
Titulo: Atomic-resolution analysis of degradation phenomena in SOFCS: A case study of SO2 poisoning in LSM cathodes

Sentencas: In addition, La2O3 formation inside the grain was also confirmed.
Titulo: Atomic-resolution analysis of degradation phenomena in SOFCS: A case study of SO2 poisoning in LSM cathodes

Sentencas: The formation of SrSO4 is identified with irreversible SOFC degradation, in addition to simple SO2 adsorption, which is reversible.
Titulo: Atomic-resolution analysis of degradation phenomena in SOFCS: A case study of SO2 poisoning in LSM cathodes
